subject: Psychology
title: Gender Development
description: A fast breakdown of Gender Development for builders.

hook.text: A toddler says 'boys don't cry.' Nobody taught him that directly. He absorbed it from a world of invisible lessons.

buildup.text: Gender development involves how children learn to understand and express gender identity and roles.

discovery.text: By age three, most children identify as boy or girl. By five, they enforce rigid gender rules on themselves and peers.

twist.text: Gender rigidity relaxes in later childhood. Adolescence brings flexibility â€” or more pressure, depending on context.

climax.text: Biology, cognition, and culture all shape gender development. No single theory captures its full complexity.

punchline.text: Children don't just learn gender. They police it before anyone asks.

quiz.question: At what age do children typically begin enforcing rigid gender rules?
